website_summaries.verdict: Thorough, user-friendly, and overflowing with photographs, this second-edition guide includes pictures of butterfly topsides and undersides.
pros: Detailed, comprehensive and user-friendly photo guide
Covers all known species of butterflies
Includes 3,500 large photographs, including topsides and undersides
Text embedded in photographs for quick field access
Color text boxes with quick facts about the species
cons: Can be difficult to find the species' name on the page

customer_reviews.title: Complicated for a Beginner
customer_reviews.text: Used to identify butterflies but just a bit too hefty for me. Need a simpler guide to identify local butterflies. This book was suggested to me by a much more advanced and knowledgeable person and I am sure it is wonderful for those people but I am a beginner and want to be able to quickly find the butterfly in the book. Also, it is a bigger book than I would want to take along on a hike.
customer_reviews.author: BPScott

customer_reviews.title: Swift Guide
customer_reviews.text: This guide does what it is intended to do very efficiently. It is a field guide to be used for quick identification of North American butterflies. It has many photos with important field marks identified. Other information such as range maps, abundance, habitat, broods, is provided very efficiently using codes and color schemes so that a great deal of information is available on every page. The book is well thought out, carefully organized and clearly presented. I think this is a significant advance in field guide presentation and if the casual observer wanted to have one field guide to cover the important information, this would be the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: Bartlett

customer_reviews.title: The photos are outstanding, showing both open and closed ...
customer_reviews.text: The photos are outstanding, showing both open and closed wing photos. The text was a bit hard to read for my ancient eyes.
customer_reviews.author: senna arrowwood

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous butterfly resource
customer_reviews.text: Ah, a book with thousands of photos. SO much more useful than painted illustrations. This book shows variations in the butterflies and the colours are natural. Divided by colour, it has a great quick reference at the back. Perfect resources for those who want to know what on earth that gorgeous thing is on that flower. Perfect teaching tool for young kids who want to collect butterflies. Front part of the book goes into detail how to collect, mount, preserve butterflies for collectors.
customer_reviews.author: Nana Glen

customer_reviews.title: The contents are excellent, but the book itself is not well made
customer_reviews.text: The contents are excellent, but the book itself is not well made, the sections pull away from the binding/spine almost from the first time I opened it.
customer_reviews.author: gadwall

customer_reviews.title: Unique Presentation that is Very Helpful for IDing!
customer_reviews.text: I really like having a full colour photo rather than “cutouts”. In addition, the notes with arrows pointing to key ID features (a line or spot to look for in particular) is very helpful for ID. I wish all guides were done this way!
customer_reviews.author: A. Hinkle

customer_reviews.title: and I love it! I have several guides with the typical ...
customer_reviews.text: I just received my book yesterday, and I love it! I have several guides with the typical paragraph of text about each species, and that's great, but this one gets to the point without much text. I love having a photo of each butterfly with the defining features pointed out. This will be my "first go-to" guide, with my others as follow-ups.
customer_reviews.author: naturenut

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I love this book. The color photos are so helpful, plus the detailed descriptions of each species. The quick reference chart at the back of the book is very helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JH

customer_reviews.title: A great guide tells how to delineate species that have a similar appearance.
customer_reviews.text: I first saw this book at a friend's place and decided to buy it because it seems to be the best book for identifying different species of butterflies that look closely alike. There are lots of comparative photographs with comments that point out how to tell the different species from one another.
customer_reviews.author: D R Elberfeld

customer_reviews.title: Great photos make identifications easy
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give this book more than 5 stars. Great photos make identifications easy. My only complaint is the book is bound really tight. I fear the binding might come apart after a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it for the visual index.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and understand. Excellent photos of living butterflies, not museum specimens. The visual index is invaluable! So happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Deanna

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: An excellent resource for butterfly identification. More photos than any other guide I own.
customer_reviews.author: Flatcat

customer_reviews.title: Great Book!!!
customer_reviews.text: Granddaughter loved this book to help identify butterflies, and learn more about them
customer_reviews.author: Regina H.

customer_reviews.title: The Best North American Butterfly guide.
customer_reviews.text: A must have for anyone interested in North American butterflies, from the casual amateur to the hardcore professional. Mr. Glassberg has done an excellent job of identifying any and all butterflies in North America. Enjoy ! Skippyfrizz
customer_reviews.author: Sheldon

customer_reviews.title: Great picures
customer_reviews.text: I wish the descriptions were more in depth. It doesn't include pictures of all the caterpillars. Otherwise it is a very nice book.
customer_reviews.author: cecebell

customer_reviews.title: Very good field guide but needs better binding system ...
customer_reviews.text: Great to get another thoughtful perspective on butterfly species identification, with a range of photographs showing regional variations; satisfyingly complete and up-to-date as to strays and recent range expansions; and I appreciate the personally helpful touch in the comments; but the binding seems to be breaking apart at the many signatures, so it doesn't appear to be nearly as sturdy as my Kaufman guide with library binding.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Best book for identification
customer_reviews.text: The product has given me a much clearer view of various butterflies for identification as well as their locations.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Figy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for research, and reference.
customer_reviews.text: I checked this out at my local library and fell in love with it. I bought it here and it's my personal treasure.
customer_reviews.author: Sheila Young

customer_reviews.title: Great reviews of butterflies with color
customer_reviews.text: Book was everything I wanted. Using also for some needle felting projects....great color illustrations.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Wiggs

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this book. I have other books but this one has great photos and lots of tips to help with identifying difficult species. It was worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: N. Knight

customer_reviews.title: Cover bound upside down
customer_reviews.text: My book literally arrived with the cover bound upside down. It might be a great guide. But that is really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingM_farm

customer_reviews.title: Organized by color of butterflies, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: A fairly thorough compilation of North American butterflies. Allows one to travel with it and discover more about the butterflies in the area.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good id book
customer_reviews.text: I am a noobie to butterfly identification and this is a good reference. To bad the names of the butterflies are not prominent on the page.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Superb
customer_reviews.text: Very useful. I have the e-book version which I can carry into the field.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. White

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and incredibly helpful! A MUST for all butterfly lovers!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Susan Rae Paulson

customer_reviews.title: Jgwells@satx.rr.com
customer_reviews.text: It is an excellent resource for identification of butterflies, especially for novice lepidopterists. I get them as gifts for beginners--now I need yet another, as I just gave my own copy to my sister.
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Wells

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: The most comprehensive resource in terns of geographic coverage and presentation of a variety of forms.
customer_reviews.author: Victor Fazio

customer_reviews.title: great photos and like how he puts confussing species next ...
customer_reviews.text: great photos and like how he puts confussing species next to each other for comparison. will be a great help on these species,like skippers..
customer_reviews.author: dallas hudson

customer_reviews.title: Amatuer.  Taking a Naturalist class and saw this book.
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful pictures and very descriptive. Text related to the specific habitat, maps, and pictures of a specific species are all included together, as opposed to searching different sections to find this information.
customer_reviews.author: William Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Wonderfully detailed
customer_reviews.text: - This reference guide has many detailed features that will be a great boon to anyone trying to identify butterflies, from amateurs to experts.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Anthony

customer_reviews.title: Not only it beautifully illustrated with color photos of every species and variation
customer_reviews.text: This is an extraordinary book. Not only it beautifully illustrated with color photos of every species and variation, but it also gives you all the pertinent data on them. If you are an amateur or a professional entomologist with a keen interest in butterflies then you have to get e copy of this book. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: waldo

customer_reviews.title: Butterflies galore
customer_reviews.text: The absolute best guide I have ever seen and I have many. Book was double wrapped and got here quickly. A definite must addition to your library if you follow butterflies. Worth every cent.
customer_reviews.author: Douglas G. Holland

customer_reviews.title: Great Photos nicely captioned... but
customer_reviews.text: I am satisfied with this book. The identification points, similar species, habitats and range maps are very good. There are some features that need improving. Species Names are in a small type size. They should be a little larger to jump off the page. The only measure of size is a representation of the forewing base to apex. I find that difficult to translate in the field, unless I catch them, which the book discourages. It does make a nice field companion to Kaufman's Butterfly Guide. Using the two, I've closed a lot of gaps.
customer_reviews.author: John R Williams

customer_reviews.title: swift guide to butterflies
customer_reviews.text: Its a great book, good color and a good addition to my field guides that I use for myself and my students.
customer_reviews.author: Carol M. Fiedler

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Excellent especially if you have a basic knowledge of butterflies!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Great photos and description
customer_reviews.text: I received the book promptly and it was everything I had hoped for. Great photos and description. I would recommend to anyone interested in learning more about these winged wonders.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Burgos

customer_reviews.title: Great field guide
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because a friend recommended it. He has photos in the book. Photos make this a go-to guide.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Schwinn

product_meta.title: A Swift Guide to Butterflies of North America: Second Edition
